page.title: 13An Interview with Pensioner
page.content: I was told that the pit had been the main industry at Scotland Gate. There was more than one pit. They are closed now. A pit tub was erected in 1984 to mark the site of the Ann Colliery. The Colliery was sunk in 1857 and 9OO men worked there. The pit closed in 1966 and was reclaimed by Northumberland County Council in 1974. The clayhole was behind the big school. The workers got clay for the brickworks there. It is a tip now. I go there to collect tadpoles and fish. I can see the remains of an old colliery nearby. There is a burn next to a railway line. People used to bowl eggs down hill and have picnics there. There was a cinema but now there is a car park. A lot of things have changed in Choppington.
